question: Who was Kofi Annan?
option1: A Ghanaian diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations
option2: A South African diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations
option3: A Nigerian diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations
option4: A Kenyan diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations
answer: A Ghanaian diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations
explanation: Kofi Annan was a Ghanaian diplomat who served as the seventh Secretary-General of the United Nations from January 1997 to December 2006. Annan and the UN were the co-recipients of the 2001 Nobel Peace Prize. He was the founder and chairman of the Kofi Annan Foundation, as well as chairman of The Elders, an international organization founded by Nelson Mandela.
